subject: Fixture Code  in SetUp() gives error
msgSnippet: Hi, Just started to program with JUnit.... According to the JUnit FAQ  A test Fixture is usefull if you have two or more tests for a common set of objects. ,
messageBody:
Hi,
Just started to program with JUnit....
According to the JUnit FAQ " A test Fixture is usefull if you have two
or more tests for a common set of objects." ,
Just look at the following test program

// this is a simple program to test the value of a arithmetic computation.
*// the object eqation is a fixture. coz it is used by test1Equ() and
test2Equ() but if I put it in my SetUp() method it throws Null Pointer
Exception and works if i declare it globally , so what must I do to keep
my Setup and Teardown methods filled.
// Plz let me know the program execution flow ..
*
import junit.framework.*;
public class TestEqu extends TestCase {
private int actualresults;
private int extpectedResults;

//Equ eqation ; *// fixture *
Equ eqation = new Equ();
public TestEqu(String nam){
super(nam);
}
protected void SetUp(){
// eqation = new Equ(); *// does not work , gives Null PointerException*
}
protected void tearDown(){
*// what must I do here *
}
public void test1Equ() {

extpectedResults = eqation.result(1,1,1);
actualresults = 3;
assertEquals(extpectedResults,actualresults);
}
public void test2Equ(){
extpectedResults = eqation.result(2,1,3);
actualresults = 10;
assertEquals(extpectedResults,actualresults);
}

public static TestSuite suite(){
return new TestSuite(TestEqu.class);
}


*//Main Program *
public class Equ {

public int result(int i, int j, int k) {
int res = (i*i)+ (2*j*k);
return res;
}

}

Plz guide me..

regards
chanduram
